intro: Scrophularia scopolii var. nusairiensis, commonly known as the Nusayri Mountain Scrophularia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Levant region. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic and epiphytic species. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with tubular shapes that attract specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
